newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Von Roll confirms sticking with deal.
newsitem.headline: Von Roll confirms sticking with deal.

text.p: Technology group Von Roll Holding AG confirmed it would stand by a deal to sell its steel activities in Switzerland to von Moos Holding AG, despite von Moos' attempt to rescind the deal.
"There are no reasons for the contract to be invalid," Von Roll's chief executive Max Amstutz told a news conference.
But Amstutz added he was willing to discuss matters with von Moos and he and the company's banks would take steps in that direction.
On Thursday, Swiss steelmaker von Moos said it would declare invalid a deal announced in June under which it would have taken over Von Roll's domestic steelmaking business.
Von Moos said a review of the business found higher environmental protection costs and lower capacity than represented in the purchase contract of June 28.
Amstutz rejected von Moos' charge it had been misled, saying the two firms had negotiated for more than three years and the business and market conditions were known to von Moos.
